Lines: Appreciation can make a day, even change a life. Your willingness to put it into words is all that is necessary.
Sometimes you will never know the value of a moment until it becomes a memory.
Now and then it's good to pause in our pursuit of happiness and just be happy.
Strive to find things to be thankful for, and just look for the good in who you are.
As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
Mind. Body. Soul. These are the three things self-care is all about.
Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
There’s only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that’s your own self.
If your compassion does not include yourself, it is incomplete.
Talk to yourself like you would to someone you love.
The world is incomprehensibly beautiful—an endless prospect of magic and wonder.
Nature brings solace in all troubles.
Spring is nature's way of saying, 'Let's party!’
The wilderness holds answers to questions we have not yet learned to ask.
An early morning walk is a blessing for the whole day.
We should indeed keep calm in the face of difference, and live our lives in a state of inclusion and wonder at the diversity of humanity.
We all came in on different ships, but we're all in the same boat now.
Strength lies in differences, not in similarities.
I believe that we are here for each other, not against each other.
Every individual matters. Every individual has a role to play. Every individual makes a difference.
Listen with curiosity. Speak with honesty. Act with integrity.
The most basic and powerful way to connect to another person is to listen. Just listen.
Deep listening is the kind of listening that can help relieve the suffering of another person.
I’m a very strong believer in listening and learning from others.
Listening is where love begins: listening to ourselves and then to our neighbors.
All doors open to courtesy.
Real strength entails being considerate and supportive of people's feelings.
Life is short but there is always time enough for courtesy.
The small courtesies sweeten life; the greater, ennoble it.
Take care, be kind, be considerate of other people and other species, and be loving.
Be a lamp, or a lifeboat, or a ladder. Help someone’s soul heal.
The fastest route to greater happiness is giving and volunteering.
An essential part of a happy, healthy life is being of service to others.
